subject: Real Estate
title: Comparable Sales and the Comp Method
description: Learn Comparable Sales and the Comp Method in one minute.

hook.text: An appraiser values your home by looking at what your neighbors' homes sold for recently.

buildup.text: This 'comparable sales' method works because buyers in the same area face the same market conditions.

discovery.text: Adjustments are made for size, condition, and features. A pool adds value; a busy road subtracts it.

twist.text: The method fails when no comparable sales exist â€” like after a crash when nobody is buying.

climax.text: Despite its flaws, the comp method determines more property values worldwide than any other approach.

punchline.text: Your home's worth depends on your neighbor's deal.

quiz.question: What does the comparable sales method use to value a home?
options: Recent sales of similar nearby homes
